title: Electron + React + TypeScript scaffold
description: Initialize the app using a modern toolchain (electron-vite with React + TypeScript).

features.title: Initialize Project
features.description: Create the Electron + React + TypeScript scaffolding so that dev work can begin
features.plan:
Implementation Plan: Electron + React + TypeScript scaffold (electron-vite)

1) Repository preparation
   1.1 Ensure prerequisites: Node.js >= 18 and Git installed.
   1.2 Create required directories (if missing):
       - scripts/
       - docs/apps/desktop/
       - docs/tasks/1/
       - src/ (top-level source container)
   1.3 Update .gitignore at repository root to append the following lines if not already present:
       - src/desktop/node_modules/
       - src/desktop/dist/
       - src/desktop/out/
       - src/desktop/.vite/
       - src/desktop/.turbo/

2) Bootstrap automation (primary setup script)
   2.1 Create a Node script at scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs that performs idempotent setup:
       - Imports: node:path, node:fs/promises, node:child_process (spawn), node:os.
       - Helper: run(cmd, args, options) to run cross-platform commands and stream stdio; reject on non-zero exit.
       - Detect repository root as process.cwd(); set targetDir = path.join(repoRoot, 'src/desktop').
       - Detect package manager: try 'pnpm --version' first; fallback to 'npm'; set pmInstall and pmExec accordingly.
       - If targetDir does not exist, scaffold with electron-vite React TypeScript template:
         a) run: ['npx', ['--yes', 'create-electron-vite@latest', 'src/desktop', '--template', 'react-ts']] from repoRoot.
         b) On failure, print clear error and exit process with non-zero code.
       - Ensure dependencies are installed inside targetDir: run `${pm} install`.
       - Read and modify package.json in targetDir to ensure these scripts exist (merge without removing existing):
         • "dev": "electron-vite dev"
         • "build": "electron-vite build"
         • "build:win": "electron-vite build --win"
         • "build:mac": "electron-vite build --mac"
         • "build:linux": "electron-vite build --linux"
         • "preview": "electron-vite preview"
         • "lint": "eslint ."
         • "typecheck": "tsc --noEmit"
       - Ensure required dependencies are present in package.json (either dependencies or devDependencies). If missing, add and install:
         • electron, electron-vite, react, typescript (respecting typical template placement: electron/electron-vite as devDependencies, react/typescript as dependencies/devDependencies per template). Only add missing ones.
       - Add ESLint/Prettier if not present:
         • Install as devDependencies: eslint, prettier, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, @typescript-eslint/parser, eslint-config-prettier.
         • Write .eslintrc.cjs if missing with content:
           module.exports = {
             root: true,
             env: { browser: true, node: true, es2022: true },
             parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser',
             parserOptions: { ecmaVersion: 'latest', sourceType: 'module', ecmaFeatures: { jsx: true } },
             plugins: ['@typescript-eslint', 'react', 'react-hooks'],
             extends: [
               'eslint:recommended',
               'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended',
               'plugin:react/recommended',
               'plugin:react-hooks/recommended',
               'prettier',
             ],
             settings: { react: { version: 'detect' } },
           };
         • Write .prettierrc.json if missing with content: { "singleQuote": true, "semi": true, "tabWidth": 2, "trailingComma": "es5", "printWidth": 100 }
       - Create .npmrc in targetDir with: save-exact=true (create or ensure the line exists).
       - Ensure baseline files exist:
         • .env.example with at least: VITE_APP_TITLE=Desktop App
         • README.md with quick-start instructions for dev, build, lint, and typecheck (referencing npm and pnpm usage).
       - If electron.vite.config.ts exists, optionally ensure productName/appId are set when default/undefined:
         • productName: 'DesktopApp'
         • appId: 'com.example.desktopapp'
         (Only set if not present; do not overwrite existing values.)
       - At end, print instructions: how to run dev (cd src/desktop && npm run dev) and build commands.
   2.2 Create shell wrappers for cross-platform convenience:
       - scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.sh with content: #!/usr/bin/env bash
         set -euo pipefail
         node "$(dirname "$0")/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs"
       - scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.ps1 with content: node "$PSScriptRoot/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs"
       - Mark .sh as executable in repo (chmod +x) during implementation.
   2.3 Ensure idempotency: Running the script multiple times should be safe. Guard file writes with existence checks and merge JSON instead of replacing. Re-run installs without error.

3) Generate the app scaffold
   3.1 Run: node scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs to create src/desktop/ and install dependencies locally.
   3.2 Verify the scaffold file layout exists:
       - electron.vite.config.ts
       - tsconfig.json
       - Source layout: either current (src/main, src/preload, src/renderer) or legacy (electron/main/index.ts, electron/preload/index.ts, src/main.tsx) depending on template version.
   3.3 Verify package.json contains the required scripts and dependencies.

4) Documentation updates
   4.1 Update docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md to mention the Electron app location:
       - Under Top-Level Directory Layout -> src/: add entry: "src/desktop/: Electron + React + TypeScript app (electron-vite)".
       - Add a brief tree outline of key generated files: electron.vite.config.ts, tsconfig.json, src/main, src/preload, src/renderer (or legacy electron/* paths).
   4.2 Create docs/apps/desktop/README.md with:
       - Overview: Electron + React + TypeScript app scaffolded by electron-vite.
       - Prerequisites: Node >= 18.
       - Setup: node scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs.
       - Commands (run inside src/desktop): dev, build, preview, lint, typecheck, build:win, build:mac, build:linux.
       - Troubleshooting tips: reinstall node_modules, permission issues, clearing caches.
   4.3 Create docs/tasks/1/README.md summarizing Feature 1.1, linking to docs/apps/desktop/README.md, and listing acceptance checks.

5) Tests for Feature 1.1
   5.1 Add tasks/1/tests/test_1_1.py with deterministic checks (no GUI):
       - Verify scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs, scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.sh, scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.ps1 exist and reference electron-vite and React TS.
       - Verify docs updates: FILE_ORGANISATION.md mentions src/desktop; docs/apps/desktop/README.md exists and mentions electron-vite, react, typescript, prerequisites; docs/tasks/1/README.md exists.
       - Verify .gitignore contains src/desktop/node_modules and src/desktop/dist.
       - Verify src/desktop exists.
       - Verify package.json contains required scripts and mentions electron-vite in dev and build scripts.
       - Verify electron.vite.config.ts and tsconfig.json exist.
       - Verify source layout (current or legacy) exists.
       - Verify required dependencies presence: electron, electron-vite, react, typescript in deps or devDeps.
       - Verify ESLint and Prettier configs exist (.eslintrc.cjs, .prettierrc.json).
       - Verify .npmrc contains save-exact=true.
       - Verify baseline .env.example and README.md in src/desktop.

6) Local validation
   6.1 Run bootstrap script locally: node scripts/bootstrap_desktop_app.mjs.
   6.2 From src/desktop, run npm run dev to ensure it starts without errors (manual check).
   6.3 From src/desktop, run npm run build to ensure it builds successfully (manual check).

7) Commit and PR
   7.1 Add and commit all new/modified files: scripts/, src/desktop/ scaffold (generated files), docs updates, tests, and .gitignore changes.
   7.2 Use commit message: "feat(app): scaffold Electron + React + TS via electron-vite under src/desktop; add bootstrap script, docs, tests".
   7.3 Open PR and ensure CI runs tests in tasks/1/tests/test_1_1.py successfully.

features.title: Configure Linting and Formatting
features.description: Make sure there's linting and formatting enabled. Assume the usage of VSCode.
features.plan:
Implementation Plan: Configure Linting and Formatting

1) Create one-shot setup script to automate config
   - Add a new directory: scripts/
   - Create scripts/setup-linting-formatting.js that:
     a) Detects package manager: prefers pnpm if pnpm-lock.yaml exists, yarn if yarn.lock, bun if bun.lockb, else npm.
     b) Installs dev dependencies:
        eslint, @typescript-eslint/parser, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin, eslint-plugin-react, eslint-plugin-react-hooks, eslint-plugin-jsx-a11y, eslint-plugin-simple-import-sort, eslint-plugin-unused-imports, eslint-plugin-prettier, eslint-config-prettier, prettier, eslint-plugin-n, eslint-plugin-vitest, husky, lint-staged
     c) Writes/overwrites the following files with the exact contents specified below:
        - .editorconfig
        - .prettierrc.json
        - .prettierignore
        - .eslintignore
        - .eslintrc.cjs
     d) Updates package.json:
        - Adds scripts:
          "lint": "eslint . --ext .cjs,.mjs,.js,.ts,.tsx",
          "lint:fix": "npm run lint -- --fix",
          "format": "prettier --write .",
          "format:check": "prettier --check .",
          "prepare": "husky install"
        - Adds lint-staged config (package.json top-level key):
          {
            "*.{js,jsx,ts,tsx,cjs,mjs}": ["eslint --fix"],
            "*.{json,css,scss,md,yml,yaml,html}": ["prettier --write"]
          }
     e) Initializes Husky and the pre-commit hook:
        - Runs: npx husky install (or pnpm dlx husky-init, then pnpm install, depending on the chosen manager)
        - Creates .husky/pre-commit with content:
          #!/usr/bin/env sh
          . "$(dirname -- "$0")/_/husky.sh"
          npx --no-install lint-staged
     f) Optionally creates CI workflow at .github/workflows/lint.yml (see step 6 for contents) unless CI already exists.
     g) Makes the script idempotent (re-running should not break; check file existence and skip/overwrite safely).

2) Define configuration files to be written by the setup script
   - .editorconfig contents:
     root = true
     [*]
     indent_style = space
     indent_size = 2
     end_of_line = lf
     charset = utf-8
     trim_trailing_whitespace = true
     insert_final_newline = true
     [*.md]
     trim_trailing_whitespace = false

   - .prettierrc.json contents (JSON):
     {
       "printWidth": 100,
       "tabWidth": 2,
       "singleQuote": true,
       "trailingComma": "all",
       "semi": true,
       "arrowParens": "always",
       "bracketSpacing": true,
       "endOfLine": "lf"
     }

   - .prettierignore contents:
     node_modules
     dist
     build
     out
     coverage
     .husky
     .github
     .next
     .cache
     .turbo
     .vite

   - .eslintignore contents:
     node_modules
     dist
     build
     out
     coverage
     .husky
     .github
     .next
     .cache
     .turbo
     .vite

   - .eslintrc.cjs contents (CJS):
     module.exports = {
       root: true,
       env: { es2023: true },
       parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser',
       parserOptions: { ecmaVersion: 'latest', sourceType: 'module' },
       plugins: [
         '@typescript-eslint',
         'react',
         'react-hooks',
         'jsx-a11y',
         'simple-import-sort',
         'unused-imports',
         'prettier',
         'n',
         'vitest'
       ],
       extends: [
         'eslint:recommended',
         'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended',
         'plugin:react/recommended',
         'plugin:react-hooks/recommended',
         'plugin:jsx-a11y/recommended',
         'plugin:n/recommended',
         'plugin:vitest/recommended',
         'plugin:prettier/recommended',
         'prettier'
       ],
       settings: { react: { version: 'detect' } },
       rules: {
         'prettier/prettier': 'error',
         'no-console': 'warn',
         'no-debugger': 'warn',
         'unused-imports/no-unused-imports': 'error',
         '@typescript-eslint/no-unused-vars': [
           'warn',
           { argsIgnorePattern: '^_', varsIgnorePattern: '^_', ignoreRestSiblings: true }
         ],
         'simple-import-sort/imports': 'warn',
         'simple-import-sort/exports': 'warn',
         'react/react-in-jsx-scope': 'off'
       },
       overrides: [
         {
           files: ['src/renderer/**/*.{ts,tsx,js,jsx}'],
           env: { browser: true }
         },
         {
           files: ['src/main/**/*.{ts,js}', 'src/preload/**/*.{ts,js}', '*.config.{ts,js,mjs,cjs}'],
           env: { node: true }
         },
         {
           files: ['**/*.{test,spec}.{ts,tsx,js,jsx}'],
           env: { 'vitest/globals': true }
         }
       ],
       ignorePatterns: ['dist', 'build', 'out', 'node_modules', '.husky']
     };

3) Implement the setup script (scripts/setup-linting-formatting.js)
   - Use Node.js fs and child_process modules.
   - Steps in script:
     a) Detect package manager (read presence of lockfiles).
     b) Build install command with the detected manager (npm i -D, pnpm add -D, yarn add -D, bun add -d).
     c) Install devDependencies listed in step 1b.
     d) Ensure scripts/ directory exists.
     e) Write config files with exact contents from step 2, creating them at repo root.
     f) Read package.json, merge scripts and lint-staged config (do not clobber existing entries; merge conservatively). Ensure "prepare": "husky install" is present.
     g) Run husky install and create .husky/pre-commit with the specified content (mark executable).
     h) If .github/workflows/ does not exist, create and write lint.yml from step 6.
     i) Log a summary of actions and next steps.

4) Update package.json manually if the script cannot (fallback)
   - Add scripts and lint-staged config as described in step 1d if the script cannot write to package.json due to environment restrictions.

5) Add developer documentation
   - Create docs/tasks/1/linting_and_formatting.md with:
     a) Overview of tools (ESLint, Prettier, Husky, lint-staged) and why.
     b) How to run the setup script: node scripts/setup-linting-formatting.js
     c) How to run locally: npm run lint, npm run lint:fix, npm run format, npm run format:check
     d) How pre-commit hooks work and how to skip them (e.g., --no-verify).
     e) Notes for Electron contexts: renderer (browser env) vs main/preload (node env) handled by ESLint overrides.
     f) Guidance for path aliases (if using tsconfig paths, add eslint-import-resolver or adjust simple-import-sort groups later).
     g) CI note: lint workflow runs on push and PR; how to troubleshoot.

6) Add optional CI workflow to enforce linting and formatting
   - Create .github/workflows/lint.yml with the following content:
     name: Lint and Format
     on:
       pull_request:
       push:
         branches: [ main ]
     jobs:
       lint:
         runs-on: ubuntu-latest
         steps:
           - uses: actions/checkout@v4
           - uses: actions/setup-node@v4
             with:
               node-version: '20'
           - name: Install dependencies
             run: |
               if [ -f pnpm-lock.yaml ]; then npm i -g pnpm && pnpm i; \
               elif [ -f yarn.lock ]; then yarn install --frozen-lockfile; \
               elif [ -f bun.lockb ]; then curl -fsSL https://bun.sh/install | bash && bun install; \
               else npm ci; fi
           - name: ESLint
             run: npm run lint
           - name: Prettier (check)
             run: npm run format:check

7) Update repository organization documentation
   - Edit docs/FILE_ORGANISATION.md to include:
     a) In Top-Level Directory Layout: add scripts/: Project automation scripts (e.g., setup-linting-formatting).
     b) Add .husky/: Git hooks configured by Husky.
     c) Add .github/workflows/: CI workflows (e.g., lint on push/PR).
     d) Note that these are introduced by the linting/formatting feature.

8) Add deterministic tests for this feature
   - Create tasks/1/tests/test_1_2.py with checks such as:
     a) Files exist: .eslintrc.cjs, .editorconfig, .prettierrc.json, .prettierignore, .eslintignore.
     b) package.json contains scripts: lint, lint:fix, format, format:check, prepare.
     c) package.json contains a lint-staged configuration with keys for JS/TS and common text files.
     d) .husky/pre-commit exists and contains "npx --no-install lint-staged".
     e) scripts/setup-linting-formatting.js exists.
     f) Optional: .github/workflows/lint.yml exists and runs lint and format:check.

9) Verify locally
   - Run: node scripts/setup-linting-formatting.js
   - Run: npm run lint and npm run format:check to ensure configurations work across src/main, src/preload, and src/renderer (if present).

10) Commit changes
   - Commit newly added files and documentation.
   - Ensure pre-commit hook runs and passes.

Notes and caveats
- If TypeScript path aliases are introduced later, consider adding eslint-import-resolver-typescript for import resolution, or configure simple-import-sort groups accordingly.
- If Jest is used instead of Vitest, replace eslint-plugin-vitest configuration with eslint-plugin-jest and adjust overrides.
- The setup script should avoid enabling type-aware rules that require parserOptions.project to keep performance acceptable and avoid tsconfig coupling by default.
